Recipe.Name: Saag Gosht

Procedure.string: Put the spinach in a pan with a few tablespoons of water and cook for 5 minutes until wilted. Blitz to a pur�e in a blender with the cooking liquid and set aside.

Heat half the oil in a frying pan over a high heat, add the coriander seeds and fry for 40 seconds until slightly dark. Add the onions and fry for 8-9 minutes until brown, then add the ginger, garlic and green chillies. Fry for 1 minute then add the tomato pur�e. Mix everything together, cook for 1 minute until blended, then transfer to a blender with enough water to cover the mixture, and blitz to make a smooth curry paste.
Heat the remaining oil in a pan over a high heat and add the lamb. Fry, stirring, for 4-5 minutes until sealed, then add the ground spices and season with salt.

Add the curry paste and enough water to make a thick sauce. Bring to the boil then cook over a low heat for 1 hour until the lamb is tender, adding more water if necessary. Add the pur�ed spinach and stir to blend. Season to taste and serve hot with rice or rotis.

Ingredient.Name: blank spinach
Ingredient.WholeLine: 200 g blank spinach, cleaned, washed and chopped

Ingredient.Name: piece fresh root ginger
Ingredient.WholeLine: 2.5 cm piece fresh root ginger, scraped and chopped

Ingredient.Name: lamb shoulder on the bone
Ingredient.WholeLine: 800 g lamb shoulder on the bone, cubed

Recipe.Description: Saag gosht is also known as palak gosht, as the words 'saag' and 'palak' are used interchangeably for spinach in some parts of India, such as Punjab. You can use lamb chops for this recipe, if you prefer.
